intro: Psychotria ratovoarisonii, commonly known as the Madagascar Psychotria, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to Madagascar. It is a shrub characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Due to its restricted range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
